intro: Trifolium variabile, commonly known as variable clover, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which consist of three oval-shaped leaflets. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in grassy areas and along roadsides. Trifolium variabile is known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it beneficial for soil enrichment.
